Articles.Content:
4 hours ago, shdwlrd said:

Number of missions since last accident-5,10,25,50: Do that number of missions without a crash, revert to launchpad or quick loads resets the count. 

This seems like a good idea, except I just imagine myself launching and then recovering missions as soon as I get past 20, in order to not lose a good streak to complete the achievement on

2 hours ago, t_v said:

This seems like a good idea, except I just imagine myself launching and then recovering missions as soon as I get past 20, in order to not lose a good streak to complete the achievement on

I can see someone trying to cheat the system with this one. (With some succeeding.) I was intending it to work like some of the Hardship: Shipbreaker achievements, you don't lose any achievements, just the counter resets. (Salvage X number of reactors without a meltdown or salvage X number of ships without an explosion. (Harder than you would think.))

"Lucy Is Here": Gain rare materials from Asteroid.

"It's Full of Stars!": Examine an Anomaly with Rover Tools

"Farmer in The Sky": Raise crops in a Colony.

"Wait. I Think I Blinked.": Get a screenshot of Kerbin from the Mun.

The Years Start Coming: Reach Year 100.

And They Don’t Stop Coming: Reach Year 500.

Fed To The Rules: Fail a tutorial.

And I Hit The Ground Running: Send a Kerbal to space in the first launch of a save.

It Didn’t Make Sense Not To Live For Fun: Go 100 years without launching any rockets from the KSC.

Your Brain Gets Smart: Unlock every part.

But Your Head Gets Dumb: Activate and decouple an engine in the same stage.

So Much To Do: Have 10 active logistics routes.

So Much To See: Visit three new star systems.

So What’s Wrong With Taking The Backstreets?: Use the cheat menu to reach orbit with a craft that has no engines.

You’ll Never Know If You Don’t Go: Go below sea level on Jool.

You’ll Never Shine If You Don’t Glow: Have 5 nuclear reactors in a colony.


And on a slightly less frivolous note…

Rock Star: Build a colony on Gilly.

Purple Rain: Build a colony on Eve.

Red Giant: Have 1000 Kerbals in a colony on or orbiting Duna.

Why Didn’t That Work?: Build a wind turbine on a body with no atmosphere.

Whoops…: Destroy a KSC building.

Return To Sender: Reach space and then land the vessel on top of the VAB.

On a related musical note:

Blinded by the light: Orbit within 1000km of Kerbol.
International dispute: Crash a vessel on the other side of the planet from the KSC

Ive been thinking of this for a while glad someone brought it up I have a few.

Explosive Launch - Have a rocket explode upon launch
To the Skies - Get into space
Metal Birds - Take off with your first plane
Going around Kerbin in 8 hours - Get into a orbit above Kerbin
One Small Fall for a Kerbal, One Bug Leap for Kerbalkind - Land on the Mun
Back in One Piece - Land an SSTO in one piece
Feiry Return - Land on Kerbin from space
Minty Heaven - Visit Minmus and back
Miner - deploy a mining drill
Mad Sientist - make fuel from ore
Green Energy - use solar panels to recharge 10,000 units of electricity
Red Sand - Land on Duna
Hike Ike - land on ike with a rover and drive 10 km
Master Communicator - Have 10 satellites obit kerbin with connectivity all green
Litterer - Have 100 pieces of space debris over Kerbin
It Connects! - Dock two ships together
Flaming Kerbal - have a kerbal exposed to a lot of heat (kelvin parameters idk)
We've come Sister - Visit the planet sister of Eve
Madness - Leave Eve and return to Kerbin
The Glorified Astroid - Visit Gilly
A Deep Hole - go to the bottom of the Mohole
The Ace of the Skies - With Jebidiah Kerman fly under the R&D bridge
Safe than Sorry - Quicksave for the first time
Time Traveler - Load a Quicksave
To the Abyss - Leave the Kerbol System
Orbital Confusion - Orbit Rask and Ruck successfully once
BIGGER BOOSTERS - Use a interstellar engine
God of Boosters - Use a torch engine
Wanderflugzeug - Visit every planet in the Kerbol system with an SSTO
The Grand Tour - Visit every planet in the Kerbol system
The Grand Tour Continued - visit every planet known to Kerbol kind
How Long Has That Been On? - Set and complete a maneuver that takes over 3 years
TOO FAST - Reach 1 Million m/s
Uh Oh - Get stranded on a exoplanet

1 hour ago, Dr. Kerbal said:

Nice to see you back!
Kessler - Crash 2 spacecraft in orbit.

12 hours ago, Dr. Kerbal said:

Going around Kerbin in 8 hours

No, in 80 minutes

Maybe some hidden achievements:

Eco-(Vall)rior - Use no polluting fuels (e.g. carbon-based liquid fuel, open-cycle nuclear, etc), and leave nothing behind in a trip to Vall and back. 
Kessler's day off - Miss a spacecraft with <15 m of clearance travelling at least 1000m/s relative
Express shipping - Complete an interplanetary supply route in 1-2 days or less
YOU NEED MOAR BOOSTER! - Try to launch vertically with a TWR > 1  
You need less boosters  - Burn up and explode in the atmosphere from going upwards too fast
A large beep for robotkind - Land on every celestial body without manned missions.
Orbital veteran - Reach a stable orbit from the surface without looking at the map view or using SAS
Phew - Dock in orbit with less then 2m/s of dV remaining (incl. rcs).
Marathon - Walk 40km  as a kerbal
Rovert to launch - Drive a rover from minmus (or mun) to the ksc launchpad by ramping off a hill, surviving reentry and then driving the rest of the way.
Making Ancient History - Crash a max-size asteroid into kerbin's giant crater.
Cant beat the weather - Start a colony within 500km of Kerbol


 

Edited November 26, 2022 by Xelo

Colony'o'tron - Land a lander without kerbal on any planet, and then build a colony. 

Gravitational game - Slingshot for over 5 times in one flight. 

This is not gonna end well… - Unlock the Nuclear Pulse Engine.

"it's just like sculpting a piece of jelly into useful shape using only rubber bands"- Unlock a fusion engine or a fusion reactor.

Chernobyl - destroy a nuclear reactor. 

Scott Manley- land on every landable planet using only one rocket. 

Kerbal resource machine- having over 100 kerbonauts. 

 BRIGHTER THAN A THOUSAND SUNS - Launch a craft with a nuclear pulse engine. 

Edited December 27, 2022 by Abel Military Services

Burn baby burn - Full throttle

BURN BABY BURN - full throttle…and get crashed

Uranium - fly 92 crafts

Liquid mercury lakes - land on moho

Take a deep breath - land on Laythe

Edited December 23, 2022 by Abel Military Services

I wonder how they could code in, “did not check staging but completed objectives despite unplanned disassembly anyway.” 
 

nah that was last Tuesday.  Now I just have to figure out how to get the science lab back, it has kerbals and one solar panel  and an antenna on the mun lander, so it does get some science done in it. It’s in a weird orbit. I need solar panels, engine and fuel.

[inserts disco music here] - let a kerbal live on Duna for a year. 

Sunday joyride - undock a craft from a space station…then dock it to another space station using only RCS thrusters.

On 12/15/2022 at 2:31 PM, Abel Military Services said:

Uranium - fly 93 crafts

You mean 92

On 11/26/2022 at 1:53 PM, Xelo said:

Cant beat the weather - Start a colony within 500km of Kerbol

That probably won't happen.

13 hours ago, Nazalassa said:

You mean 92

yep

Project Horizons- land an unmanned lander on mun and build a colony. 

Sending Tom Home - (needs Project Horizons) launch an unmanned rocket from the mun colony…and crash it on KSC. 

Dr Goddard - launch your first liquid fuel rocket. 

 

Wernher Von Braun  - Crash a liquid fuel rocket on the island airfield

No idea if this has been said for a achievement.

 

"Fire Everything!" - During a landing, or in a landing process, if meaning in process of in the atmosphere, where catastrophic failure of the rocket where multiple parts of the rocket fail/get destroyed, and requires an abort and assist of a type of propulsion to "land safely" on the ground.

88 - Reach >1c without cheats

Winning A Bet - Land on Minmus using only EVA fuel, starting at and returning to aa >10km orbit

Budget Cuts - Land on the Mun and return using only command chairs or ladders for Kerbal occupation
You've gone so far… - land on eve and return…then got overcooked in the Kerbin atmosphere
Chicago Pile - build your first nuclear reactor.

Jump! Jump! - let a kerbal survive a planecrash by EVA

It takes two - launch a male kerbal and a female kerbal to space in a ship. 

Sleep! - let a unmanned probe hibernate 

New Kork - Having more than 100, 000 kerbals in a colony

Elon Kerman - Colonize Duna before year 10

Portal 2 - use debug to teleport a kerbal from KSC to mun surface

 

Saving Astronaut Jebediah - Leave Jeb on any planet or moon, then bring him home. 

Rich Purnell - Successfully operate a Kerbin Gravitational Slingshot. 

KPL - enter the R&D.
